elements.title: Ford Strikers Riot (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Pulitzer jury said that Ford Strikers Riot (pictured) is "a brutal picture, it sums up much of the labor history of 1941"?

elements.title: Brandon Coleman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that 320-pound (145 kg) Brandon Coleman runs at 18 miles per hour (29 km/h)?

elements.title: South Africa's genocide case against Israel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in South Africa's genocide case against Israel, the International Court of Justice ordered Israel to "punish the direct and public incitement to commit genocide" against Palestinians in Gaza?

elements.title: Turno (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after losing his brother to suicide, Turno collaborated with Skepsis and Charlotte Plank on a single about men's mental health?

elements.title: Pantheon ad Lucem (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the stage for Pantheon ad Lucem by Alexander McQueen evoked imagery of alien starships and the Roman Colosseum?

elements.title: Mexia Supermarket (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when Mexia Supermarket was abandoned because of its owners' bankruptcy, all of the food inside was left to rot for more than three months?

elements.title: Charlie Deakin Davies (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the British musician Charlie Deakin Davies cofounded the Trans Creative Collective, a directory of transgender musicians?

elements.title: his New York City house (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Henry Clay Frick would not take World War I as an excuse for delays in the construction of his New York City house?

elements.title: Bill Post (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Bill Post helped invent the Pop-Tart?
